org.panthercode.arctic.core.processing.modules

Class Step

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.panthercode.arctic.core.processing.modules.AbstractModule
      • org.panthercode.arctic.core.processing.modules.Step
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, Identifiable, Versionable, Module

    public abstract class Step
extends AbstractModule
    The step class is used to execute client code. By overriding the method step() the user is able to execute its own implementation.

    If you inherit form this class, you should override stop() method, because the original one only try to set process state to "Stopped". Therefore it will not challenge the process to stop.

    It's on your own responsibility to change process state at runtime! E. g. if process waits, change process state to "Waiting". When process goes on, change state to "Running". Otherwise maybe you will provoke bad behavior of the system.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
           throws java.lang.Exception
        Call step() method and checks returned value. If value is true the process state is changed to "Succeeded"; Otherwise to "Failed". If an exception is thrown, the object try to set the state to "Failed".
        Specified by:
        start in interface Module
        Overrides:
        start in class AbstractModule
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Is eventually thrown by the concrete implementation.

      • step

        public abstract boolean step()
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        This method is called by start() method. It contains concrete implemented code of some functionality.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the actual run was successful; Otherwise false.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
